title: The physics of a pool vortex

multiple-choice.question: What happens when a plate is dragged through the water in the pool?

options.label: A
options.text: The water becomes turbulent and chaotic.

options.label: B
options.text: Perfect black circles form on the bottom of the pool.

multiple-choice.question: What is a vortex in the context of fluids?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of wave that transfers energy.

options.label: B
options.text: A gas or liquid moving in circles with a vortex line.

options.label: C
options.text: A type of turbulence that occurs in fluids.

options.label: D
options.text: A phenomenon that only occurs in solids.

multiple-choice.question: Why do vortices often form when there's a difference in fluid speed?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of the difference in temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the difference in density.

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the shear force caused by the difference in velocity.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the vortex as it moves through the water?

options.label: A
options.text: It loses all its energy and dissipates.

options.label: B
options.text: It continues spinning and only loses some energy through friction.

options.label: C
options.text: It becomes a wave and transfers energy.

options.label: D
options.text: It becomes a turbulence and chaotic.

multiple-choice.question: Why do the two dips on the water's surface stay together?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are two separate vortices.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are connected by a half vortex ring.

multiple-choice.question: What is a half vortex ring?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of wave that transfers energy.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of turbulence that occurs in fluids.

options.label: C
options.text: A curved vortex line that connects two dips on the water's surface.

options.label: D
options.text: A phenomenon that only occurs in solids.

multiple-choice.question: According to Helmholtz's law, what cannot happen to a vortex line?

options.label: A
options.text: It cannot start or end in a fluid.

options.label: B
options.text: It cannot close into a loop.

options.label: C
options.text: It cannot end at a boundary.

multiple-choice.question: Why do the dark spots form in the center of the vortex?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of the balance between gravity, centripetal forces, and surface tension.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the difference in fluid speed.

multiple-choice.question: What type of lens is created by the funnel shape of the vortex?

options.label: D
options.text: A lens that focuses light away from the center.

multiple-choice.question: What is necessary for creating the perfect black circles on the bottom of the pool?

options.label: A
options.text: The water has to be turbulent.

options.label: B
options.text: The sun has to be out, and the water has to be very still.

options.label: C
options.text: The plate has to be moved slowly.

options.label: D
options.text: The pool has to be deep.

options.label: D

title: The importance of a breakdown

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the main problems of human beings according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: We're too good at expressing our emotions.

options.label: B
options.text: We're too good at keeping going and living up to external expectations.

options.label: C
options.text: We're too good at prioritizing our own needs.

options.label: D
options.text: We're too good at handling stress.

multiple-choice.question: What can be the result of constantly trying to meet external expectations without addressing our own needs?

options.label: A
options.text: We become more confident and self-assured.

options.label: B
options.text: We develop a stronger sense of self.

options.label: C
options.text: We may experience a breakdown or mental health crisis.

options.label: D
options.text: We become more resilient to stress.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is a breakdown?

options.label: A
options.text: A random piece of madness or malfunction.

options.label: B
options.text: A bid for health and an attempt to force growth, self-understanding, and self-development.

options.label: C
options.text: A sign of weakness and lack of resilience.

options.label: D
options.text: A result of poor time management.

multiple-choice.question: What is the danger of simply medicalizing a breakdown and trying to "fix" it quickly?

options.label: A
options.text: We may miss the lesson embedded within our sickness.

options.label: B
options.text: We may experience more severe symptoms.

options.label: C
options.text: We may become dependent on medication.

options.label: D
options.text: We may lose our job or relationships.

multiple-choice.question: Why do we often break down, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Because we're too weak to handle stress.

options.label: B
options.text: Because we've been ignoring our emotional needs and haven't flexed or grown in a long time.

options.label: C
options.text: Because we're too busy with work and responsibilities.

options.label: D
options.text: Because we're not smart enough to manage our emotions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the conscious mind's tendency, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It is eager to engage with difficult emotions and challenges.

options.label: B
options.text: It is inherently lazy and squeamish, and reluctant to engage with difficult emotions.

options.label: C
options.text: It is neutral and objective, and makes rational decisions.

options.label: D
options.text: It is overly critical and judgmental.

multiple-choice.question: What can be the result of ignoring our emotional needs and not addressing them in a timely manner?

options.label: A
options.text: We may experience a smooth and peaceful life.

options.label: B
options.text: We may have a breakdown or mental health crisis.

options.label: C
options.text: We may become more confident and self-assured.

multiple-choice.question: What is a crisis or breakdown, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: A sign of weakness and failure.

options.label: B
options.text: An appetite for growth that hasn't found another way of expressing itself.

options.label: D
options.text: A random event that happens to some people.

multiple-choice.question: What can be the outcome of a breakdown, if we're able to work through it and learn from it?

options.label: A
options.text: We may become more stuck in our ways and resistant to change.

options.label: B
options.text: We may experience more severe symptoms and a longer recovery time.

options.label: C
options.text: We may rebuild our lives on a more authentic and sincere basis.

options.label: D
options.text: We may lose our sense of identity and purpose.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the ultimate goal of a breakdown or crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: To destroy our current life and relationships.

options.label: B
options.text: To help us avoid dealing with difficult emotions and challenges.

options.label: C
options.text: To dislodge us from a toxic status quo and prompt growth and change.

options.label: D
options.text: To make us more compliant and obedient to external expectations.

title: Why you don’t hear about the ozone layer anymore

options.label: B
